skill.name: alphafold-database
skill.description: Access AlphaFold 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, download PDB/mmCIF files, analyze confidence metrics (pLDDT, PAE), for drug discovery and structural biology.
skill.summary: Access AlphaFold 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, download ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate scientific tool for accessing the AlphaFold protein structure database. All static findings are false positives. The analyzer misinterpreted documentation text, URL patterns, and common HTTP library usage as security threats. Actual functionality uses safe Biopython library calls, standard HTTP requests to authorized EBI APIs, and subprocess calls with hardcoded arguments for Google Cloud bulk downloads.

content.user_title: Access AlphaFold protein structures by UniProt ID
content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to computational protein structure predictions for drug discovery and structural biology studies. This skill provides direct access to AlphaFold DB's 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures, enabling retrieval by UniProt ID, download of coordinate files, and analysis of confidence metrics.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve AlphaFold predictions by UniProt accession ID
Download structure files in PDB, mmCIF, and binary CIF formats
Access confidence metrics including pLDDT scores and PAE matrices
Parse and analyze structures using Biopython
Download bulk proteome data via Google Cloud Platform
limitations: Does not generate new predictions (requires AlphaFold or external service)
Lacks experimental validation (predictions are computational models)
Rate limits apply to REST API requests (use Google Cloud for bulk access)

use_cases.title: Retrieve protein structures for docking
use_cases.description: Download target protein structures for computational docking studies and analyze binding site conformations.

use_cases.title: Analyze prediction confidence
use_cases.description: Evaluate pLDDT and PAE metrics to identify reliable structural regions for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Build automated pipelines
use_cases.description: Integrate AlphaFold access into computational workflows for large-scale protein analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Get single protein structure
prompt_templates.scenario: Download structure for a specific protein
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the AlphaFold structure for UniProt ID P00520 in mmCIF format and show the pLDDT confidence scores.

prompt_templates.title: Compare multiple proteins
prompt_templates.prompt: Download structures for P00520, P12931, and P04637. Compare their average pLDDT scores and identify high-confidence regions.

prompt_templates.title: Batch download by species
prompt_templates.prompt: Download all AlphaFold predictions for E. coli (taxonomy ID 83333) using Google Cloud bulk access.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate with analysis pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Python script that takes a list of UniProt IDs, downloads their structures, extracts CA coordinates, and calculates inter-residue distances.

output_examples.input: Download the AlphaFold structure for P00520 and analyze confidence

best_practices: Use Biopython for simple single-protein access (cleaner API than direct HTTP calls)
Cache downloaded files locally to avoid repeated API requests and rate limits
For bulk downloads over 100 proteins, use Google Cloud Storage instead of REST API
anti_patterns: Avoid using shell=True with subprocess when calling gsutil (use list form instead)
Do not ignore pLDDT scores when interpreting structures (low confidence regions may be unreliable)
Avoid downloading individual files for whole proteomes (use tar archives from Google Cloud)

faq.question: What is the difference between PDB and mmCIF formats?
faq.answer: PDB is legacy format with 99,999 atom limit. mmCIF is modern standard supporting larger structures with full metadata.

faq.question: How reliable are AlphaFold predictions?
faq.answer: Predictions with pLDDT >90 are very reliable. Regions below 50 may be disordered. Always check confidence metrics.

faq.question: Can I use AlphaFold structures for drug docking?
faq.answer: Yes, but validate high-confidence regions. Low confidence areas may not reflect true structure. Consider multiple models.

faq.question: What is the rate limit for the AlphaFold API?
faq.answer: Official limits are not published. Use 10 concurrent requests max with 100-200ms delays between calls.

faq.question: How do I download an entire species proteome?
Does this skill support multi-chain protein complexes?
faq.answer: No. AlphaFold DB provides single-chain predictions only. For complexes, model each chain separately.
